Generated methods stubs -- ie/ those generated by "Override/Implement Methods"
-- for methods that return parameter values return the invalid value of 0.  Ie/
if you do a "Override/Implement Methods" for

-----
import java.util.Map;

public class MapImplementation<K, V> implements Map<K, V> {
}
-----

you get, among others:

   public V get(Object key) {
      // TODO Auto-generated method stub
      return 0;
   }

   public V put(K key, V value) {
      // TODO Auto-generated method stub
      return 0;
   }

   public V remove(Object key) {
      // TODO Auto-generated method stub
      return 0;
   }

Since, in Tiger, primitives can't be used for generic paramters, it would be
proper and correct to return null instead of 0.

Generated methods stubs -- ie/ those generated by "Override/Implement Methods"
-- for methods that return parameter values return the invalid value of 0.  Ie/
if you do a "Override/Implement Methods" for

-----
import java.util.Map;

public class MapImplementation<K, V> implements Map<K, V> {
}
-----

you get, among others:

   public V get(Object key) {
      // TODO Auto-generated method stub
      return 0;
   }

   public V put(K key, V value) {
      // TODO Auto-generated method stub
      return 0;
   }

   public V remove(Object key) {
      // TODO Auto-generated method stub
      return 0;
   }

Since, in Tiger, primitives can't be used for generic paramters, it would be
proper and correct to return null instead of 0.
Fixed > 20050120


[1.5] Generated generic method stubs have invalid return values [code generation] [override]
